content:
Web search results:

[1] "The answer is clearly not that American barriers are costless or that Europes single market has made no difference. It is easy to get American firms to testify about their costs from duplicative requirements, and a barrage of econometric studies have shown that EU rules have reduced similar costs in Europe."
URL: https://www.foreignaffairs.com/articles/europe/2022-04-19/single-market-power

[2] "A well-functioning single market is key to achieving strategic autonomy and resilience ; The European single market remains one of the EUs greatest achievements and a key tool to protect people and businesses in times of crisis. Following a ceremony and debate at the start of the plenary session, Parliament adopted on Wednesday a resolution ..."
URL: https://europeansting.com/2023/01/19/30-years-of-the-eu-single-market-time-to-face-new-challenges/

[3] "The single market is the unified market encompassing all EU member states. Iceland, Liechtenstein and Norway participate in the EUs single market as parties to the European Economic Area (EEA) agreement, while Switzerland does so through a series of bilateral agreements with the EU.The single market is based on four freedoms: free movement of goods, people, services and capital between ..."
URL: https://ukandeu.ac.uk/the-facts/what-is-the-single-market/

[4] "The eurocurrency market is a major source of finance for international trade because of ease of convertibility and the absence of domestic restrictions on trading. Euromarket as the Single..."
URL: https://www.investopedia.com/terms/e/euromarket.asp

[5] "One of the ways that we recognise the fundamental worth of every person is by acknowledging and respecting their human rights. Human rights are a set of principles concerned with equality and fairness. They recognise our freedom to make choices about our lives and develop our potential as human beings."
URL: https://leverageedu.com/blog/essay-on-human-rights/

[6] "Financial Stability - As sustainable development promises steady development the economies of countries can become stronger by using renewable sources of energy as compared to using fossil fuels, of which there is only a particular amount on our planet. Examples of Sustainable Development"
URL: https://leverageedu.com/blog/essay-on-sustainable-development/

[7] "Usually, an article is a piece of writing that is published in a newspaper or Magazine for guiding a large audience on a particular topic or subject. The main objective to write an article is to make some changes to the world by presenting facts, stats, or views."
URL: https://www.aplustopper.com/article-writing/

[8] "Long and Short Essays on School Uniform for Students and Kids in English We are providing children and students with essay samples on an extended essay of 500 words and a short piece of 150 words on the topic School Uniform for reference. Long Essay on School Uniform 500 Words in English"
URL: https://www.aplustopper.com/school-uniform-essay/

[9] "Write an article on this topic to create awareness among the people. (Word limit: 200 words) 6 You are concerned about the wastage of money and manpower due to the frequent elections in your country. Write an article on the urgent need to have a stable government. (Word limit: 200 words) 7 You are Rani/Raghav."
URL: https://www.learncram.com/english-grammar/article-writing-topics-for-class-12/

[10] "The treaty was designed to enhance European political and economic integration by creating a single currency (the euro ), a unified foreign and security policy, and common citizenship rights and by advancing cooperation in the areas of immigration, asylum, and judicial affairs."
URL: https://www.britannica.com/topic/European-Union
Current date: 10/03/2023

Instructions: Using the provided web search results, write a comprehensive reply to the given query. Make sure to cite results using [[number](URL)] notation after the reference. If the provided search results refer to multiple subjects with the same name, write separate answers for each subject.
Query: Write an 150 words long article on the following topic: Why is the EU Single Market important for Latvia, giving an example (e.g. specific industry, historical event)and what challenges remain for the future?
